intro: Cissus palmata var. balansana, commonly known as the Madagascar nettle, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, net-veined leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its stems are often hairy and can develop adventitious roots, aiding in its climbing habit. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded, forested areas.
